hashtag#hiring *ADC Engineer II, EC2 with Security Clearance*, Herndon, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Herndonjobs hashtag#Virginiajobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/g4Fmmq3F DESCRIPTION Would you like to help implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve the world's most complex technical problems? Do you have a deep passion and desire to engineer and operate the world's largest cloud computing infrastructure to provide a better world for future generations? Amazon Web Services is seeking top industry technical experts to grow our team dedicated to expanding our Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) to government customers. We are seeking a talented engineer skilled in the art of integration who understands the Agile mindset and DevOps philosophies, yet is not constrained by how "things are usually done" and is willing to decompose and reinvent systems, processes, and tools. We're looking for a technical expert for one of the largest compute services on the planet; if you possess that rare mix of depth in Operations, Networking, and Systems Engineering then we are waiting for your application. This position requires that the candidate selected must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph. The position further requires the candidate to opt into a commensurate clearance for each government agency for which they perform AWS work. Key job responsibilitiesYou'll be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. This is an opportunity to operate and engineer systems on a massive scale, and to gain top-notch experience in cloud computing. You'll be surrounded by people who are smart, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class service is critical to customer success. You'll become expert at EC2 platform diagnosis, response, measurement, and automation. You will design and build the operational scalability that sustains the platform's insane growth. You will be able to measure your success by its visible impact on the efficiency and effectiveness of government services for our nation. A day in the lifeAmazon has a fast-paced environment where we "Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History." On a "typical" day engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues. About the teamWhy AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses. “Trevor, is it just me or is the IT project management market really struggling at the moment? It seems more and more PMs are looking for work? What can I do to stand out?”You’re not imagining it.The IT PM market in Australia is tight right now and many experienced PMs are feeling it:👉 Out of work for months👉 Ghosted by recruiters👉 Watching job ads vanish before they hit ‘Apply’So… what’s really going on?1. Infra work has dried upCloud, SaaS and Infrastructure-as-Code have reduced demand for traditional Infra PMs.2. Offshoring is squeezing local PMsOver 20,000 tech roles were offshored in 2024 - especially in banking and telco.3. AI is chainsawing the adminTools like Copilot and ClickUp AI now generate reports, task plans, meeting summaries - even risk logs.4. Hiring cycles are slower, competition’s tougherIt now takes 10 weeks longer (on average) to land a role than it did pre-COVID5. The jobs that do exist call for unicornsEspecially in banking and insurance. Good luck - the unicorn farm is closed to the public!So what do you need to do to stand out?Play a different game. The old one’s broken.- Stop applying with the same resume and hoping something changes.- Show impact, not activity like “Cut delivery time by 30% across 5 squads.” or “Saved $2M via DevOps uplift.”- Use GenAI to sharpen your edgeUse ChatGPT or GenAI to: • Compare resume to JD • Identify strengths and gaps • Build mini case studies to show employers and recruiter how you’ll adaptThen hustle your way into a convo - or apply with a knock-out cover letter and tailored resume.You don’t have to be a unicorn. You just need to connect the dots for the person reading your application.Also, how about reinventing yourself to get ahead of the curve rather than falling off it?✅ Show you’re AI-augmented“Used Fireflies and Copilot to automate reporting and action tracking.”✅ Double down on what AI can’t replace - people and change leadershipStrong communication, stakeholder wrangling and calm under pressure? That’s your edge.✅ Target sectors still growingCloud, cyber, ESG, AI governance, compliance, government digital - these are still hiring.✅ Get active and visibleYour LinkedIn isn’t a CV - it’s your positioning statement, your personal billboard. Show up. Share insights. Be relevant. Tell the world who you are!The market is tough - but not hopeless.There’s still strong demand for PMs who are:✅ Tech-savvy✅ Value-driven✅ Adaptable✅ People-powered✅ AI-readyIf you’re a PM feeling stuck, I get it.My advice? Reposition, rebrand and reconnect.Give it a go. What do you have to lose?hashtag#ProjectManagement hashtag#ITJobs hashtag#AI hashtag#CareerAGILITY hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Cloud hashtag#Cyber hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#DigitalDelivery

hashtag#hiring *ADC Engineer II, EC2 with Security Clearance*, Herndon, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Herndonjobs hashtag#Virginiajobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/g4Fmmq3F DESCRIPTION Would you like to help implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve the world's most complex technical problems? Do you have a deep passion and desire to engineer and operate the world's largest cloud computing infrastructure to provide a better world for future generations? Amazon Web Services is seeking top industry technical experts to grow our team dedicated to expanding our Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) to government customers. We are seeking a talented engineer skilled in the art of integration who understands the Agile mindset and DevOps philosophies, yet is not constrained by how "things are usually done" and is willing to decompose and reinvent systems, processes, and tools. We're looking for a technical expert for one of the largest compute services on the planet; if you possess that rare mix of depth in Operations, Networking, and Systems Engineering then we are waiting for your application. This position requires that the candidate selected must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph. The position further requires the candidate to opt into a commensurate clearance for each government agency for which they perform AWS work. Key job responsibilitiesYou'll be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. This is an opportunity to operate and engineer systems on a massive scale, and to gain top-notch experience in cloud computing. You'll be surrounded by people who are smart, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class service is critical to customer success. You'll become expert at EC2 platform diagnosis, response, measurement, and automation. You will design and build the operational scalability that sustains the platform's insane growth. You will be able to measure your success by its visible impact on the efficiency and effectiveness of government services for our nation. A day in the lifeAmazon has a fast-paced environment where we "Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History." On a "typical" day engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues. About the teamWhy AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses. Day 1 🚀 The Future of Software Engineering in India – What’s Next? 🤖Remember when everyone thought engineering = government job or TCS/Infosys? 🤡Well, 2025 is NOT that era anymore. The game is changing FAST.🔥 What’s happening in the tech world?✅ AI & Automation → Not here to "steal" your job, but to "change" it. Engineers who adapt will thrive. Those who don’t? Well… they might be writing LinkedIn posts about layoffs. 💀✅ Full-Stack & AI Skills Are GOLD → Companies now want problem solvers, not just coders. If you can build end-to-end applications + AI-powered features, you're unstoppable in the market.✅ Remote Work is Normal → You no longer need to move to Bangalore, Pune, or Hyderabad. Companies are hiring remotely, global opportunities are opening up 🌍.✅ Startups are BOOMING → MNCs are cool, but startups pay big 💰 if you have the right skills. Want equity, flexible work, and fast growth? Startups are waiting.---💡 What Should You Do in 2025?🔹 Learn AI + Cloud + DevOps basics → These aren’t just buzzwords; they’re what companies pay the highest salaries for.🔹 Improve Soft Skills → You can write the best code, but if you can’t explain it, someone else will get promoted over you. Learn to communicate!🔹 Contribute to Open Source & Build Real Projects → Your GitHub & LinkedIn are the new resumes. No one cares about a 2-page CV anymore.🔹 Think Beyond Just Jobs → The freelance & startup ecosystem is booming. Many techies are making 10x salaries by building products & consulting.---🎯 Final Thought:Software engineering in India is not dying, not saturated, and not boring.It’s evolving, and the ones who adapt & upskill will be the real winners.👀 What’s YOUR take?Where do you see the future of software engineering in India? “Trevor, is it just me or is the IT project management market really struggling at the moment? It seems more and more PMs are looking for work? What can I do to stand out?”You’re not imagining it.The IT PM market in Australia is tight right now and many experienced PMs are feeling it:👉 Out of work for months👉 Ghosted by recruiters👉 Watching job ads vanish before they hit ‘Apply’So… what’s really going on?1. Infra work has dried upCloud, SaaS and Infrastructure-as-Code have reduced demand for traditional Infra PMs.2. Offshoring is squeezing local PMsOver 20,000 tech roles were offshored in 2024 - especially in banking and telco.3. AI is chainsawing the adminTools like Copilot and ClickUp AI now generate reports, task plans, meeting summaries - even risk logs.4. Hiring cycles are slower, competition’s tougherIt now takes 10 weeks longer (on average) to land a role than it did pre-COVID5. The jobs that do exist call for unicornsEspecially in banking and insurance. Good luck - the unicorn farm is closed to the public!So what do you need to do to stand out?Play a different game. The old one’s broken.- Stop applying with the same resume and hoping something changes.- Show impact, not activity like “Cut delivery time by 30% across 5 squads.” or “Saved $2M via DevOps uplift.”- Use GenAI to sharpen your edgeUse ChatGPT or GenAI to: • Compare resume to JD • Identify strengths and gaps • Build mini case studies to show employers and recruiter how you’ll adaptThen hustle your way into a convo - or apply with a knock-out cover letter and tailored resume.You don’t have to be a unicorn. You just need to connect the dots for the person reading your application.Also, how about reinventing yourself to get ahead of the curve rather than falling off it?✅ Show you’re AI-augmented“Used Fireflies and Copilot to automate reporting and action tracking.”✅ Double down on what AI can’t replace - people and change leadershipStrong communication, stakeholder wrangling and calm under pressure? That’s your edge.✅ Target sectors still growingCloud, cyber, ESG, AI governance, compliance, government digital - these are still hiring.✅ Get active and visibleYour LinkedIn isn’t a CV - it’s your positioning statement, your personal billboard. Show up. Share insights. Be relevant. Tell the world who you are!The market is tough - but not hopeless.There’s still strong demand for PMs who are:✅ Tech-savvy✅ Value-driven✅ Adaptable✅ People-powered✅ AI-readyIf you’re a PM feeling stuck, I get it.My advice? Reposition, rebrand and reconnect.Give it a go. What do you have to lose?hashtag#ProjectManagement hashtag#ITJobs hashtag#AI hashtag#CareerAGILITY hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Cloud hashtag#Cyber hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#DigitalDelivery

This position requires that the candidate selected must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph. The position further requires the candidate to opt into a commensurate clearance for each government agency for which they perform AWS work. You'll become expert at EC2 platform diagnosis, response, measurement, and automation. You will design and build the operational scalability that sustains the platform's insane growth. You will be able to measure your success by its visible impact on the efficiency and effectiveness of government services for our nation. A day in the lifeAmazon has a fast-paced environment where we "Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History." On a "typical" day engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues. About the teamWhy AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. Day 1 🚀 The Future of Software Engineering in India – What’s Next? 🤖Remember when everyone thought engineering = government job or TCS/Infosys? 🤡Well, 2025 is NOT that era anymore. The game is changing FAST.🔥 What’s happening in the tech world?✅ AI & Automation → Not here to "steal" your job, but to "change" it. Engineers who adapt will thrive. Those who don’t? Well… they might be writing LinkedIn posts about layoffs. 💀✅ Full-Stack & AI Skills Are GOLD → Companies now want problem solvers, not just coders. If you can build end-to-end applications + AI-powered features, you're unstoppable in the market.✅ Remote Work is Normal → You no longer need to move to Bangalore, Pune, or Hyderabad. Companies are hiring remotely, global opportunities are opening up 🌍.✅ Startups are BOOMING → MNCs are cool, but startups pay big 💰 if you have the right skills. Want equity, flexible work, and fast growth? Startups are waiting.---💡 What Should You Do in 2025?🔹 Learn AI + Cloud + DevOps basics → These aren’t just buzzwords; they’re what companies pay the highest salaries for.🔹 Improve Soft Skills → You can write the best code, but if you can’t explain it, someone else will get promoted over you. Learn to communicate!🔹 Contribute to Open Source & Build Real Projects → Your GitHub & LinkedIn are the new resumes. No one cares about a 2-page CV anymore.🔹 Think Beyond Just Jobs → The freelance & startup ecosystem is booming. Many techies are making 10x salaries by building products & consulting.---🎯 Final Thought:Software engineering in India is not dying, not saturated, and not boring.It’s evolving, and the ones who adapt & upskill will be the real winners.👀 What’s YOUR take?Where do you see the future of software engineering in India? “Trevor, is it just me or is the IT project management market really struggling at the moment? It seems more and more PMs are looking for work? What can I do to stand out?”You’re not imagining it.The IT PM market in Australia is tight right now and many experienced PMs are feeling it:👉 Out of work for months👉 Ghosted by recruiters👉 Watching job ads vanish before they hit ‘Apply’So… what’s really going on?1. Infra work has dried upCloud, SaaS and Infrastructure-as-Code have reduced demand for traditional Infra PMs.2. Offshoring is squeezing local PMsOver 20,000 tech roles were offshored in 2024 - especially in banking and telco.3. AI is chainsawing the adminTools like Copilot and ClickUp AI now generate reports, task plans, meeting summaries - even risk logs.4. Hiring cycles are slower, competition’s tougherIt now takes 10 weeks longer (on average) to land a role than it did pre-COVID5. The jobs that do exist call for unicornsEspecially in banking and insurance. Good luck - the unicorn farm is closed to the public!So what do you need to do to stand out?Play a different game. The old one’s broken.- Stop applying with the same resume and hoping something changes.- Show impact, not activity like “Cut delivery time by 30% across 5 squads.” or “Saved $2M via DevOps uplift.”- Use GenAI to sharpen your edgeUse ChatGPT or GenAI to: • Compare resume to JD • Identify strengths and gaps • Build mini case studies to show employers and recruiter how you’ll adaptThen hustle your way into a convo - or apply with a knock-out cover letter and tailored resume.You don’t have to be a unicorn. You just need to connect the dots for the person reading your application.Also, how about reinventing yourself to get ahead of the curve rather than falling off it?✅ Show you’re AI-augmented“Used Fireflies and Copilot to automate reporting and action tracking.”✅ Double down on what AI can’t replace - people and change leadershipStrong communication, stakeholder wrangling and calm under pressure? That’s your edge.✅ Target sectors still growingCloud, cyber, ESG, AI governance, compliance, government digital - these are still hiring.✅ Get active and visibleYour LinkedIn isn’t a CV - it’s your positioning statement, your personal billboard. Show up. Share insights. Be relevant. Tell the world who you are!The market is tough - but not hopeless.There’s still strong demand for PMs who are:✅ Tech-savvy✅ Value-driven✅ Adaptable✅ People-powered✅ AI-readyIf you’re a PM feeling stuck, I get it.My advice? Reposition, rebrand and reconnect.Give it a go. What do you have to lose?hashtag#ProjectManagement hashtag#ITJobs hashtag#AI hashtag#CareerAGILITY hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Cloud hashtag#Cyber hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#DigitalDelivery

You just need to connect the dots for the person reading your application.Also, how about reinventing yourself to get ahead of the curve rather than falling off it?✅ Show you’re AI-augmented“Used Fireflies and Copilot to automate reporting and action tracking.”✅ Double down on what AI can’t replace - people and change leadershipStrong communication, stakeholder wrangling and calm under pressure? That’s your edge.✅ Target sectors still growingCloud, cyber, ESG, AI governance, compliance, government digital - these are still hiring.✅ Get active and visibleYour LinkedIn isn’t a CV - it’s your positioning statement, your personal billboard. Show up. Share insights. Be relevant. Tell the world who you are!The market is tough - but not hopeless.There’s still strong demand for PMs who are:✅ Tech-savvy✅ Value-driven✅ Adaptable✅ People-powered✅ AI-readyIf you’re a PM feeling stuck, I get it.My advice? Reposition, rebrand and reconnect.Give it a go. hashtag#hiring *ADC Engineer II, EC2 with Security Clearance*, Herndon, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Herndonjobs hashtag#Virginiajobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/g4Fmmq3F DESCRIPTION Would you like to help implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve the world's most complex technical problems? Do you have a deep passion and desire to engineer and operate the world's largest cloud computing infrastructure to provide a better world for future generations? Amazon Web Services is seeking top industry technical experts to grow our team dedicated to expanding our Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) to government customers. We are seeking a talented engineer skilled in the art of integration who understands the Agile mindset and DevOps philosophies, yet is not constrained by how "things are usually done" and is willing to decompose and reinvent systems, processes, and tools. We're looking for a technical expert for one of the largest compute services on the planet; if you possess that rare mix of depth in Operations, Networking, and Systems Engineering then we are waiting for your application. This position requires that the candidate selected must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph. The position further requires the candidate to opt into a commensurate clearance for each government agency for which they perform AWS work. Key job responsibilitiesYou'll be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. This is an opportunity to operate and engineer systems on a massive scale, and to gain top-notch experience in cloud computing. You'll be surrounded by people who are smart, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class service is critical to customer success. You'll become expert at EC2 platform diagnosis, response, measurement, and automation. You will design and build the operational scalability that sustains the platform's insane growth. You will be able to measure your success by its visible impact on the efficiency and effectiveness of government services for our nation. A day in the lifeAmazon has a fast-paced environment where we "Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History." On a "typical" day engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues. About the teamWhy AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses. Day 1 🚀 The Future of Software Engineering in India – What’s Next? 🤖Remember when everyone thought engineering = government job or TCS/Infosys? 🤡Well, 2025 is NOT that era anymore. The game is changing FAST.🔥 What’s happening in the tech world?✅ AI & Automation → Not here to "steal" your job, but to "change" it. Engineers who adapt will thrive. Those who don’t? Well… they might be writing LinkedIn posts about layoffs. 💀✅ Full-Stack & AI Skills Are GOLD → Companies now want problem solvers, not just coders. If you can build end-to-end applications + AI-powered features, you're unstoppable in the market.✅ Remote Work is Normal → You no longer need to move to Bangalore, Pune, or Hyderabad. Companies are hiring remotely, global opportunities are opening up 🌍.✅ Startups are BOOMING → MNCs are cool, but startups pay big 💰 if you have the right skills. Want equity, flexible work, and fast growth? Startups are waiting.---💡 What Should You Do in 2025?🔹 Learn AI + Cloud + DevOps basics → These aren’t just buzzwords; they’re what companies pay the highest salaries for.🔹 Improve Soft Skills → You can write the best code, but if you can’t explain it, someone else will get promoted over you. Learn to communicate!🔹 Contribute to Open Source & Build Real Projects → Your GitHub & LinkedIn are the new resumes. No one cares about a 2-page CV anymore.🔹 Think Beyond Just Jobs → The freelance & startup ecosystem is booming. Many techies are making 10x salaries by building products & consulting.---🎯 Final Thought:Software engineering in India is not dying, not saturated, and not boring.It’s evolving, and the ones who adapt & upskill will be the real winners.👀 What’s YOUR take?Where do you see the future of software engineering in India? “Trevor, is it just me or is the IT project management market really struggling at the moment? It seems more and more PMs are looking for work? What can I do to stand out?”You’re not imagining it.The IT PM market in Australia is tight right now and many experienced PMs are feeling it:👉 Out of work for months👉 Ghosted by recruiters👉 Watching job ads vanish before they hit ‘Apply’So… what’s really going on?1. Infra work has dried upCloud, SaaS and Infrastructure-as-Code have reduced demand for traditional Infra PMs.2. Offshoring is squeezing local PMsOver 20,000 tech roles were offshored in 2024 - especially in banking and telco.3. AI is chainsawing the adminTools like Copilot and ClickUp AI now generate reports, task plans, meeting summaries - even risk logs.4. Hiring cycles are slower, competition’s tougherIt now takes 10 weeks longer (on average) to land a role than it did pre-COVID5. The jobs that do exist call for unicornsEspecially in banking and insurance. Good luck - the unicorn farm is closed to the public!So what do you need to do to stand out?Play a different game. The old one’s broken.- Stop applying with the same resume and hoping something changes.- Show impact, not activity like “Cut delivery time by 30% across 5 squads.” or “Saved $2M via DevOps uplift.”- Use GenAI to sharpen your edgeUse ChatGPT or GenAI to: • Compare resume to JD • Identify strengths and gaps • Build mini case studies to show employers and recruiter how you’ll adaptThen hustle your way into a convo - or apply with a knock-out cover letter and tailored resume.You don’t have to be a unicorn. You just need to connect the dots for the person reading your application.Also, how about reinventing yourself to get ahead of the curve rather than falling off it?✅ Show you’re AI-augmented“Used Fireflies and Copilot to automate reporting and action tracking.”✅ Double down on what AI can’t replace - people and change leadershipStrong communication, stakeholder wrangling and calm under pressure? That’s your edge.✅ Target sectors still growingCloud, cyber, ESG, AI governance, compliance, government digital - these are still hiring.✅ Get active and visibleYour LinkedIn isn’t a CV - it’s your positioning statement, your personal billboard. Show up. Share insights. Be relevant. Tell the world who you are!The market is tough - but not hopeless.There’s still strong demand for PMs who are:✅ Tech-savvy✅ Value-driven✅ Adaptable✅ People-powered✅ AI-readyIf you’re a PM feeling stuck, I get it.My advice? Reposition, rebrand and reconnect.Give it a go. What do you have to lose?hashtag#ProjectManagement hashtag#ITJobs hashtag#AI hashtag#CareerAGILITY hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Cloud hashtag#Cyber hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#DigitalDelivery

Show up. Share insights. Be relevant. Tell the world who you are!The market is tough - but not hopeless.There’s still strong demand for PMs who are:✅ Tech-savvy✅ Value-driven✅ Adaptable✅ People-powered✅ AI-readyIf you’re a PM feeling stuck, I get it.My advice? Reposition, rebrand and reconnect.Give it a go. hashtag#hiring *ADC Engineer II, EC2 with Security Clearance*, Herndon, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Herndonjobs hashtag#Virginiajobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/g4Fmmq3F DESCRIPTION Would you like to help implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve the world's most complex technical problems? Do you have a deep passion and desire to engineer and operate the world's largest cloud computing infrastructure to provide a better world for future generations? Amazon Web Services is seeking top industry technical experts to grow our team dedicated to expanding our Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) to government customers. We are seeking a talented engineer skilled in the art of integration who understands the Agile mindset and DevOps philosophies, yet is not constrained by how "things are usually done" and is willing to decompose and reinvent systems, processes, and tools. We're looking for a technical expert for one of the largest compute services on the planet; if you possess that rare mix of depth in Operations, Networking, and Systems Engineering then we are waiting for your application. This position requires that the candidate selected must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph. The position further requires the candidate to opt into a commensurate clearance for each government agency for which they perform AWS work. Key job responsibilitiesYou'll be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. This is an opportunity to operate and engineer systems on a massive scale, and to gain top-notch experience in cloud computing. You'll be surrounded by people who are smart, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class service is critical to customer success. You'll become expert at EC2 platform diagnosis, response, measurement, and automation. You will design and build the operational scalability that sustains the platform's insane growth. You will be able to measure your success by its visible impact on the efficiency and effectiveness of government services for our nation. A day in the lifeAmazon has a fast-paced environment where we "Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History." On a "typical" day engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues. About the teamWhy AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
